abstract.p: Letter from Dr Bernd Wollschlaeger says now that Israel has withdrawn from Lebanon, United Nations must act quickly to disarm Hezbollah guerrillas, challenge Syria to withdraw from Lebanon, and send multinational force to guarantee peace

block.p: As an Israeli citizen, I am relieved to see Israel's withdrawal from the Lebanese security zone (front page, May 24). As a former Israeli Army officer, I am dismayed at the hasty withdrawal. How can we protect our country if Hezbollah fighters are roaming the border promising the liberation of ''occupied Palestine''?

Syria's support of Hezbollah could jeopardize the fragile peace effort and drag us into war. Where is the Lebanese Army to reclaim the sovereignty of Lebanon? Should it be Israel's responsibility to protect the legitimate interest of Christians there?

As an Israeli citizen, I am relieved to see Israel's withdrawal from the Lebanese security zone (front page, May 24). As a former Israeli Army officer, I am dismayed at the hasty withdrawal. How can we protect our country if Hezbollah fighters are roaming the border promising the liberation of ''occupied Palestine''?

Syria's support of Hezbollah could jeopardize the fragile peace effort and drag us into war. Where is the Lebanese Army to reclaim the sovereignty of Lebanon? Should it be Israel's responsibility to protect the legitimate interest of Christians there?

The United Nations should act now. Hezbollah guerrillas should be disarmed, Syria should be challenged by the Arab League to withdraw from Lebanon, and a multinational force should guarantee the peace.
